conclusion: Analyze forces on equilateral triangular conductor frame in magnetic field.
Equilateral triangle composed of uniform resistance wires; points A and B connected to power supply; magnetic field perpendicular to triangle.
Current is distributed equally among the three sides of the triangle.
Current through each side of the triangle is I/3.
Ampere force on AB section is given as F.
Force F is due to current I/3 flowing through AB section in magnetic field.
Current I/3 flows through AC and BC sections; forces on AC and BC are perpendicular to these sides.
Forces on AC and BC are equal in magnitude to force on AB, directed at 120° angles to each other.
Resultant force found by vector addition of three forces.
Resultant force calculated using formula for three equal forces at 120° angles: F_resultant = √3 × F.
Magnitude of resultant Ampere force on three resistance wires is √3 × F.
